dependencies.title: The dependencies schema
dependencies.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.
examples: `target-postgres` [requires](https://www.psycopg.org/docs/install.html#runtime-requirements) the [`libpq` library](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/libpq.html) to be available on your system. If you've installed PostgreSQL, you should already have it, but you can also install it by itself using the [`libpq-dev` package](https://pkgs.org/download/libpq-dev) on Ubuntu/Debian or the [`libpq` Homebrew formula](https://formulae.brew.sh/formula/libpq) on macOS.

examples.name: snowflake_account
examples.description: `ACCOUNT` might require the `region` and `cloud` platform where your account is located, in the form of: `<your_account_name>.<region_id>.<cloud>` (e.g. `xy12345.east-us-2.azure`) Refer to Snowflake's documentation about Account: https://docs.snowflake.net/manuals/user-guide/connecting.html#your-snowflake-account-name-and-url

examples.name: snowflake_authenticator
examples.description: Specifies the authentication provider for snowflake to use. Valud options are the internal one ("snowflake"), a browser session ("externalbrowser"), or Okta ("https://<your_okta_account_name>.okta.com"). See the snowflake docs for more details.
